I've got a strange problem with my crawl jobs that manifests itself
regularly but not predictably. Every once in a while, a job will get
stuck in the "Preparing" state and I have to manually intervene and kill
it.

My situation is unusual because I've embedded Heritrix in a long-running
program that continuously submits and monitors jobs. The average job
size is rather small, only about 300-500 URLs, and the average job time
is only about 3-5 minutes.

Based on the jstack excerpt below, it looks like something tried to
pause the job, but it never made it out of the "Preparing" state.

"ToeThread #2" prio=10 tid=0x0a2fa000 nid=0x2380 in Object.wait()
[0xb422e000..0xb422efc0]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (on object monitor)
        at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
        at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:485)
        at
org.archive.crawler.frontier.AbstractFrontier.preNext(AbstractFrontier.java:666)
        - locked <0x71c2e0f8> (a
org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbFrontier)
        at
org.archive.crawler.frontier.WorkQueueFrontier.next(WorkQueueFrontier.java:632)
        at
org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:144)

"ToeThread #1" prio=10 tid=0x0a487400 nid=0x237f in Object.wait()
[0xb3dce000..0xb3dcf040]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (on object monitor)
        at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
        at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:485)
        at
org.archive.crawler.frontier.AbstractFrontier.preNext(AbstractFrontier.java:666)

        at

        at
